page.title: 18Cade Cottage
page.content: {Cade Cottage}was built in the 15th century but from 1075 had been a small shepherds hut. It was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. It is situated next to Palmarsh's Oakstead Petrol Station on Dymchurch Road. In 1963 the house was in danger of being knocked down. The cottage's kitchen is built over the place where the old shepherd's hut once stood. When Mr and Mrs Joyce moved in the house had to be practically rebuilt. Under the kitchen is a tunnel which{Jack Cade,}the famous Kentish rebel, used to get to an old bridle path which is now the path down to the quarry. The cottage has 9 rooms, 3 bedrooms upstairs, all of which have curtains instead of doors. Downstairs has 1 bedroom, a kitchen, a sitting room, a dining room, a toilet and a music room. Four of the rooms have doors.
